identificationModule.briefTitle: Bronchial Hyperreactivity in Atopic Dermatitis Patients - a 10 Year Follow-up
identificationModule.officialTitle: Bronchial Hyperreactivity in Atopic Dermatitis Patients - a 10 Year Follow-up

responsibleParty.oldNameTitle: Sakari Reitamo, MD, PhD, Specialist in Dermatology, Acting Professor
responsibleParty.oldOrganization: Helsinki University Central Hospital, Department of Dermatology

descriptionModule.briefSummary:
The investigators will contact 64 patients with atopic dermatitis (AD) who participated in a long-term tacrolimus ointment trial in Helsinki 10 years ago, and ask them to participate in this follow-up study. The investigators will do the same tests as 10 years ago, i.e. bronchial hyperreactivity, skin prick tests, serum-IgE, Mantoux-test (2 TU), and questionnaires about asthma and allergic rhinitis symptoms. The investigators also collect data about their AD medication during the last 10 years.

The investigators hypothesis is that when the skin condition improves in patients with AD the brochial hyperreactivity improves. The investigators also want to study whether different treatments play a role in the development or resolution of bronchial hyperreactivity.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription:
We will by letters and telephone contact all patients (n=64) who fulfill the inclusion criteria for this study.

The testing in the study (bronchial hyperreactivity, skin prick testing, serum IgE) is cross-sectional, but we retrospectively collect data from the last 10 years about the skin condition and medication for atopic diseases.

bioSpec.description: Serum is collected for measurement of IgE

armGroups.label: AD patients
armGroups.description: AD patients who fulfill the inclusion criteria for the study

interventions.name: Histamine provocation
interventions.description: A dosimetric histamine challenge test in which the provocative dose of inhaled histamine producing a decrease of 15% in FEV1 is measured.

interventions.name: Skin prick tests
interventions.description: Skin prick testing will be performed for: birch, timothy, mugwort, alder, pine, cat, dog, horse, house dust mite, Cladosporium herbarum.

interventions.name: Serum IgE blood testing
interventions.description: One blood test to measure total serum IgE

interventions.name: Mantoux-testing
interventions.description: Tuberculin (2 TU) s.c. on the forearm. The test is read after 72 hours.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Patient has participated in the FG-506-06-21 study in Helsinki
* Patient was tested for bronchial hyperreactivity in the years 1998-2000
* Patient gives signed informed consent to participate in this study
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: The investigators invite all patients who participated in the FG-506-06-21 tacrolimus ointment study, and who at baseline in that study were tested for bronchial hyperreactivity.

overallOfficials.name: Sakari Reitamo, MD, PhD
overallOfficials.affiliation: Skin- and Allergy Hospital, Dep. of Dermatology

locations.facility: Skin- and Allergy Hospital, Department of Dermatology

references.citation: Virtanen H, Remitz A, Malmberg P, Rytila P, Metso T, Haahtela T, Reitamo S. Topical tacrolimus in the treatment of atopic dermatitis--does it benefit the airways? A 4-year open follow-up. J Allergy Clin Immunol. 2007 Dec;120(6):1464-6. doi: 10.1016/j.jaci.2007.08.021. Epub 2007 Oct 1. No abstract available.
